meanings.definition: The act of deceiving or tricking someone.
meanings.sent1: The cozenage of the unsuspecting customer was quickly uncovered.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his cozenage and refused to be fooled.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cozenage was so obvious that even the children could tell.
meanings.sent4: His cozenage was like a carefully crafted illusion, fooling many.
meanings.sent5: The cozenage of the con artist left a trail of victims in its wake.

meanings.sent1: He tried to cozenage his way out of trouble, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent2: The scammer attempted to cozenage the elderly couple out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: She cozenaged her friends into believing she had won the lottery.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises were nothing but cozenage to gain votes.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox cozenaged the rabbit into leaving its burrow.
